alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 5:38PM EDT until May 13 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Amelia, Cumberland and Prince Edward. In south central Virginia, Nottoway. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 537 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over portions of the area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmville, Crewe, Longwood University, Hampden Sydney, Nottoway, Burkeville, Rice, Jetersville, Spainville, Prospect, Moran, Deatonville, Jennings Ordinary, Burkes Tavern, Stoddert, Oliveville, Fergusonville, Maplewood, Raines Tavern and Hawk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
